com.SIMRacingApps.Util

Class SendKeys

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.SIMRacingApps.Util.SendKeys

  • public class SendKeys
extends java.lang.Object
    This class emulates the syntax of the Visual Basic SendKeys class found at SendKeys

    Only the key names found at KeyEvent by using what comes after the "VK_". The following VB names have been crossed referenced to the VK_ names as well. 

      BACKSPACE   BACK_SPACE
  BKSP        BACK_SPACE
  BS          BACK_SPACE
  CAPSLOCK    CAPS_LOCK
  CTRL        CONTROL
  DEL         DELETE
  INS         INSERT
  PGDN        PAGE_DOWN
  PGUP        PAGE_UP
  WINKEY      WINDOWS
  
 Example: 
   1. Set the default delay.
   2. Run Notepad, wait for it to run.
   3. Enter some text.
   4. Open the about dialog.
 
    {DELAY=50}{WINDOWS}rnotepad{ENTER}{DELAY 1000}hello world{ALT}ha
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeffrey Gilliam
    Copyright:
    Copyright (C) 2015 - 2019 Jeffrey Gilliam
    License:
    Apache License 2.0

    • Method Detail

      • getDelay

        public static int getDelay()
        Returns the current default delay in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The current delay in milliseconds

      • setDelay

        public static void setDelay(int ms)
        Sets the default delay. This can also be specified with the command line argument "sendkeysdelay".
        Parameters:
        ms - The number of milliseconds.

      • setDriver

        public static void setDriver(SendKeys.Driver driver)
        Sets the driver that sendkeys should use. The choices are enumerated in the Driver enum (AWT,WINDOWS).
        Parameters:
        driver - The type of driver to use, AWT or WINDOWS

      • delay

        public static void delay(int ms)
        Delays for the specified number of milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        ms - The number of milliseconds.

      • sendKeys

        public static java.lang.String sendKeys(java.lang.String keystrokes)
        This method parses the string and sends the keys.
        Parameters:
        keystrokes - The keystrokes to send.
        Returns:
        The keys sent.
